label: 殿上人
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: literally hall men"; men who had been individually authorized by the reigning sovereign to enter the Courtiers' Hall (Tenjō no Ma) of his private residence within the Palace grounds, where their names were inscribed on a special roll, and where they preformed numerous designated functions, such as standing night duty (p. 791). [殿上間]"
